text: When I saw this <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/juliasim-simulating-reality-upcoming-product-by-julia-computing/58785> I thought the announcement is 6 days late. :see_no_evil:

attachments.title: JuliaSim - Simulating Reality (upcoming product by Julia Computing)
attachments.text: JuliaSim: Simulating Reality Coming soon: JuliaSim is a next generation cloud-based simulation platform, combining the latest techniques in SciML with equation-based digital twin modeling and simulation. Surrogatize your models, use pre-accelerated models from the thousands of available models, generate digital twins from data, and more. Bringing Julia to Industrial Scale Modeling and Simulation JuliaSim allows you to directly import models from its Model Store into your Julia environment, ma...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: JuliaSim - Simulating Reality (upcoming product by Julia Computing)

elements.text: I thought the announcement is 6 days late.

text: I'm glad to see Julia doing this. That digital twin thing is becoming pretty trendy. I'm not convinced it isn't just a rebrand of stuff other people have been doing for years, but that's beside the point I guess. It's good to see such a young toolset keeping pace and in some ways doing better than something that's been around since the dawn of time (MatLab)

text: Simulated Reality in Julia? Maybe that is our existence! :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

elements.text: Simulated Reality in Julia? Maybe that is our existence!
